_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
Bonjour Tremblant!

Welcome and happy holidays! The mountain received a fresh 13 cm blanket of snow overnight, creating perfect winter conditions. Our teams have been busy preparing the slopes so you can make the most of this special day. There’s no better way to celebrate the season than skiing or boarding fresh snow—have a fantastic day out there!

 The Mitik and Progression Parks are now open and looking fantastic, thanks to the fresh snow and the dedicated work of our maintenance teams. 

Alpine touring & snowshoeing: Discover 14 beautiful sections open and waiting for you today. 

 Enjoy a beautiful day on the mountain and happy holidays! 

Mountain safety tip of the week: Be careful when using the ski lifts.
Knowing how to board ski lifts is essential to ensure the safety of all users. Here are a few tips for a safe experience:

• Familiarize yourself with the lift before using it and pay attention.
• Ask the ski lift attendant if you are unfamiliar with how it works.
• Follow the rules posted along the lift route.
• Watch the chairlift safety video: Vidéo utilisation sécuritaire télésiège
 
Snow fall is recorded daily at 5 a.m from mid-mountain at North Side (550 m / 1,800 ft). This data, based on 24 hours, provides a picture of on-mountain conditions. Actual accumulation may differ from the official report. Be aware of changing conditions. Lifts and trails exist in a mountain environment and may close due to weather, usage and/or special maintenance.
_inspectorSnowReport.SafetyReport: This Thursday morning, 13 cm of fresh snow has fallen. The Mitik and Progression Parks are now open and looking fantastic, thanks to the fresh snow and the dedicated work of our maintenance teams. Alpine touring & snowshoeing: Discover 14 beautiful sections open and waiting for you today. With snowmaking underway, visibility may be reduced and conditions can vary—please stay alert and ski cautiously.
_inspectorSnowReport.SafetyReportFrench: Ce jeudi matin, 13 cm de nouvelle neige sont tombés. Les parcs Mitik et Progression sont ouverts et magnifiques, grâce à la neige fraîche et au travail dévoué de nos équipes d'entretien. Ski de randonnée alpine et raquette : découvrez 14 magnifiques sections ouvertes. En raison de la fabrication de neige artificielle, la visibilité peut être réduite et les conditions peuvent varier. Veuillez rester vigilant et skier prudemment.
